title: Chester Ismay
text:
I help individuals and teams use AI and data science with confidence, not just for the hype, but to actually get projects completed effectively and efficiently.
I work at the intersection of AI, statistics, and communication by designing hands-on, engaging learning experiences that make complex ideas approachable. I support teams building responsible, reproducible, and effective data workflows. I build tools that are thoroughly tested with the user in mind at all times.
Whether it’s a university rolling out an AI curriculum, a nonprofit streamlining its data analysis, or a company making sense of noisy dashboards, I bring a human-first mindset to the table. I enjoy helping people learn something new, debug a problem, or bring a fuzzy idea into reality. Outside of work, you’ll probably find me hiking, rowing, or exploring a new dataset for fun. I collaborate best with teams who value clarity, curiosity, and thoughtful problem-solving. If that sounds like you, let’s connect.





I partner with universities, nonprofits, governmental agencies, and companies to design and refine data workflows powered by AI, automation, and reproducible practices. Whether you’re looking to streamline your reporting, explore LLM-powered analysis, or build a data-informed culture, I help teams cut through complexity and focus on what works.



I create and teach hands-on learning experiences in R, Python, SQL, and AI. These range from short, targeted workshops to full-semester courses and interactive online programs. My teaching emphasizes curiosity, practical problem solving, and empowering learners at all levels to use data with confidence.



I speak on the future of data science education, practical uses of AI in analysis and learning, and what it takes to make technical ideas stick. My talks are energetic and example-driven, focused on bridging the gap between what’s possible and what’s useful for educators, analysts, and decision-makers.



I’m co-author of ModernDive and other open educational tools that help make statistics and data science more accessible, modern, and fun. My writing blends clarity, code, and context. I always keep the learner in mind.

title: About Me
text:
I grew up in Vale, South Dakota, a small town of 114 people just north of Rapid City. I earned my B.S. in Applied and Computational Mathematics from the South Dakota School of Mines & Technology. Drawn to the outdoors, I moved to Flagstaff and completed an M.S. in Statistics at Northern Arizona University. After working as an actuarial student in Scottsdale, I returned to graduate school and completed my Ph.D. in Statistics at Arizona State University. My dissertation (under the guidance of Dr. Randall Eubank) focused on testing pseudorandom number generators in a parallel computing environment using R and C++.
Since then, I’ve worked across academia, online education, and industry, remaining at the intersection of statistics, data science, AI, and education. I specialize in making statistical thinking approachable and useful, helping audiences from beginners to executives understand and apply complex ideas. My work blends theory and computation with a strong emphasis on problem framing and interpretation.
Lately, I’ve helped organizations improve data workflows, adopt reproducible practices, and integrate AI and automation into their work. You can learn more on my LinkedIn profile. I also enjoy hiking, traveling, pickleball, reading, and rowing on my Hydrow.

title: Consulting
text:
Areas of Expertise


Technical Communication
Translate complex statistical and AI concepts into clear, engaging insights for all audiences.
→ Slide decks, interactive tutorials, executive summaries, and curriculum design


Data Science Strategy
Build data and AI capabilities aligned with business goals through appropriate problem framing.
→ From proof-of-concept to production-ready workflows


LLM & AI Integration
Leverage Large Language Models (LLMs) to augment and improve your analyses, reporting, or user-facing tools.
→ Prompt engineering, RAG pipelines, trust and transparency


Project Planning & Execution
Lead data projects from scoping to delivery with a clear, outcome-driven approach.
→ Stakeholder alignment, milestones, deliverables, and retrospectives


Supervised Machine Learning
Develop, tune, and evaluate predictive models that solve real-world problems.
→ Classification, regression, cross-validation, and model deployment


Statistical Consulting
Design sound experiments, choose the right models, and interpret results responsibly.
→ From t-tests to simulation-based inference to multi-level models to causal inference


Reproducible Workflows
Streamline your team’s work with R, Python, and literate programming.
→ Reports, dashboards, automated pipelines, version control


Data Wrangling
Tame messy data using modern tools in Python like pandas and polars or in R with the tidyverse and tidymodels.
→ Cleaning, reshaping, validating, and preparing data at scale


Data Visualization
Craft dashboards and visual narratives that speak clearly and drive action.
→ Storytelling with ggplot2, plotly, Shiny, and more
